nodes.bodyText: I don't think this is true, now that we have the new sanitization logic.  If there's a malformed URL, it's due to the parameters' values, right?
Also fix the other three instances of this verbiage in this class.

If this.getID() returns, say, "12345abc", then this call would NOT return "An invalid path parameter passed in. It must be numeric." error message, even though that would be an invalid ID.
I can't think of any alternatives, but just calling out to start the discussion.
The API would handle the error in that case, so it's probably a minor concern, right?

Ya, you are correct. There are ways around it like passing in what each parameter should be with each parameter in an Array for something like that. However, I think it's a minor concern and isn't worth making the SDK more complicated.
